app.title: Healthy Homes Practitioner App
app.intro: This tool helps field workers assess housing-related health risks and social needs.

inspection.title: Home Inspection Checklist
inspection.mold: Visible mold on walls, ceilings, or furniture
inspection.pests: Presence of cockroaches, rodents, or other pests
inspection.leaks: Leaks or water damage in ceilings, walls, or floors
inspection.lead: Peeling or chipping paint in homes built before 1978
inspection.noHVAC: No functioning heating or cooling system
inspection.noVent: Lack of exhaust fans in kitchen or bathroom
inspection.tripHazards: Trip hazards such as loose rugs, cords, or cluttered walkways
inspection.asthmaTriggers: Asthma triggers like dust buildup, pets, or strong odors
inspection.electrical: Exposed wiring or lack of grounded outlets
inspection.structural: Cracks in walls, ceilings, or foundation
inspection.safetyDevices: Missing or non-functional smoke or carbon monoxide detectors
inspection.accessibility: Barriers for people with mobility challenges (stairs, no ramps)
inspection.sanitation: Overflowing garbage, sewage backup, or strong odors
inspection.ventilation: Windows that do not open or poor air circulation
inspection.pesticideUse: Strong smell of pesticides or improper storage
inspection.overcrowding: Too many occupants for available rooms or beds
inspection.noise: Excessive noise from nearby traffic, factories, or neighbors
